result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Ernest Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

15A 044732
Set DNA surcharge as DOC/COLLECT.
CORRECTION to sentencing entry dated 12/2/2015 to reflect correct restituion information.
CORRECTION made to Sentencing entry dated 12/2/2015 to reflect correct amount of months for probation.

Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Matthew Ernest Jones in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant ordered to serve 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin Prison System, 12 MONTS INITIAL CONFINEMENT and 12 MONTH EXTENDED SUPERVISION. This sentence is imposed and stayed, and the defendant is ordered to serve 24 MONTHS of probation. 

AS TO COUNT 2 AMENDED
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to case 15CM3289, with credit for 81 days time served, straight time. WITH GOOD TIME, THIS WILL BE A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 3 AMENDED
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, straight time. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-Absolute Sobriety to include random drug screens (If maintained, the defendant can use the Milwaukee County Bus System
-Maintain employment
-Parenting Classes
-Mental Health and follow through with any recommended treatment
-No firearms
-NO CONTACT with Cameron W., Greg B., or Vincent R.
-Letter of apologies to all named individuals above through the probation agent
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay
-Restitution set at ZERO for case 15CM1670.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample for counts 2 and 3 and pay the applicable surcharge

*Restitution to be paid (for case 15CM1405) in the amount of $311.28 to the Milwaukee County Transit System, to be paid during period of probation on above case. Bail on deposit to apply to restitution first, then to remaining costs. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Filed,
